com.amazon.device.associates
Interface ShoppingService

public interface ShoppingService

ShoppingService class is the primary class for integrating Amazon Shopping Experience to your app. All methods of ShoppingService are asynchronous in nature. ShoppingService API follows a request and response pattern. The requests are initiated via ShoppingService methods and the responses are delivered through callbacks implemented as part of ShoppingListener.

Before calling ShoppingService methods, make sure you initialize API with AssociatesAPI.initialize(com.amazon.device.associates.AssociatesAPI.Config) and register ShoppingListener via setListener(com.amazon.device.associates.ShoppingListener) method. ShoppingService methods called before this will throw NoListenerException.

All methods of ShoppingService are thread safe and do not require any synchronization primitives.

Method Detail

setListener

void setListener(ShoppingListener listener)
Sets a ShoppingListener to receive response callbacks.

Parameters:
listener - a ShoppingListener object.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if listener is null.

getServiceStatus

RequestId getServiceStatus()
                           throws NoListenerException

Call this method to initiate a request to retrieve the status of ShoppingService. In response to this method, ShoppingListener.onServiceStatusResponse(ServiceStatusResponse) callback is invoked. ServiceStatusResponse includes the API capability information such as supportedPurchaseExperiences. A best practice is to call this method in onResume of the main activity.

Returns:
The same request ID will be returned in ServiceStatusResponse. You can use RequestId to match requests with the corresponding response callbacks. This will be helpful if multiple requests are initiated at the same time.
Throws:
NoListenerException - If the method is called before setting ShoppingListener.

getReceipts

RequestId getReceipts(ReceiptsRequest request)
                      throws NoListenerException

Call this method to retrieve receipts for purchases made through the app by the current user. Receipts will only be returned for purchases for which receiveReceipt was set to true in PurchaseRequest. The receipts are returned in ShoppingListener.onReceiptsResponse(ReceiptsResponse).

You can use receipts to make digital bundles in your app with physical product purchases i.e buy physical item and unlock functionality in the app. getReceipts should be called from OnResume of the main activity to ensure purchase history is retrieved when the app is launched.

Parameters:
request - ReceiptsRequest object. Use ReceiptsRequest to specify the offset for retrieving the receipts.
Returns:
RequestId. The same request ID will be returned in ReceiptsResponse. You can use RequestId to match requests with the corresponding response callbacks. This will be helpful if multiple requests are initiated at the same time.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if request is null.
NoListenerException - If the method is called before setting ShoppingListener.

search

RequestId search(SearchRequest request)
                 throws NoListenerException

Call this method to initiate product search in Amazon product catalog using keyword and category. The search results are returned in ShoppingListener.onSearchResponse(SearchResponse). Search results are localized and include product ID, product title, product description, product price, and product image URL. If sortType is not set in the request, SortType.RELEVANCE will be applied as a default sort type.

The search results are returned in a paginated fashion. You can use SearchRequest constructor to specify the specific search page to retrieve.

In addition in the SearchRequest you can specify search filter using SearchRequest.addFilter(FilterType, String) and sort order using SearchRequest.setSortType(SortType).

Parameters:
request - SearchRequest object. You can use the SearchRequest object to formulate the search query. It includes product category, keyword, search filter, and sorting order.
Returns:
The same request ID will be returned in SearchResponse. You can use RequestId to match requests with the corresponding response callbacks. This will be helpful if multiple requests are initiated at the same time.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If request is null.
NoListenerException - If the method is called before setting ShoppingListener.

searchById

RequestId searchById(SearchByIdRequest request)
                     throws NoListenerException

Call this method to initiate product lookup in Amazon product catalog using a product ID. Product information is returned in ShoppingListener.onSearchByIdResponse(SearchByIdResponse). Product information is localized and includes product ID, product title, product description, product price, and product image URL.

You can specify multiple products in SearchByIdRequest.

Parameters:
request - SearchByIdRequest object. Use SearchByIdRequest to specify products IDs to look up. You can specify multiple product IDs in a single SearchByIdRequest to lookup multiple products in a single call.
Returns:
The same request ID will be returned in SearchByIdResponse. You can use RequestId to match requests with the corresponding response callbacks. This will be helpful if multiple requests are initiated at the same time.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If request is null.
NoListenerException - If the method is called before setting ShoppingListener.

purchase

RequestId purchase(PurchaseRequest request)
                   throws NoListenerException

Call this method to initiate purchase of a single item using product ID. You can specify the product ID in PurchaseRequest. ShoppingListener.onPurchaseResponse(PurchaseResponse) will be called on completion of the purchase flow.

You should confirm if the product ID specified in PurchaseRequest is valid by checking PurchaseResponse.getStatus() in ShoppingListener.onPurchaseResponse(PurchaseResponse). In case of an invalid ID, PurchaseResponse.getStatus() will return INVALID_ID.

Parameters:
request - PurchaseRequest Object. Use PurchaseRequest to specify the product ID to purchase. You can only specify a single product ID in PurchaseRequest Object.
Returns:
The same request ID will be returned in PurchaseResponse. You can use RequestId to match requests with the corresponding response callbacks. This will be helpful if multiple requests are initiated at the same time.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If PurchaseRequest object is null.
NoListenerException - If the method is called before setting ShoppingListener.
